name: gitHex.undoLast
description: Undo the last git-hex operation by resetting to the backup ref created before the operation. REQUIRES: clean working tree (no uncommitted changes).

repoPath.description: Path to the git repository (defaults to single configured root)

force.description: Allow undo even if new commits exist after the backup (those commits will be lost)

headBefore.description: HEAD commit hash before the undo

headAfter.description: HEAD commit hash after the undo (the restored state)

undoneOperation.description: Name of the operation that was undone

backupRef.description: The backup ref that was restored

commitsUndone.description: Number of commits that were undone

summary.description: Human-readable explanation of what was undone
